intro: Sonerila celebica, commonly known as the Celebes starling vine, is a tropical climbing plant native to the Moluccas in Indonesia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its dark green, glossy leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces bright yellow or orange berries that are edible but not commonly consumed by humans. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in tropical gardens.
